description: Automated Force Plate Calibration Messages and Texts

text: [AUTO-CAL] This automated system will guide you through
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸ“‹ STEP B: Load Cell Calibration (CENTER placement)
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Patience and attention to detail
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸŽ¯ At each step, you can:
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Type 'SKIP' to skip current step
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Type 'STATUS' to see current progress
[AUTO-CAL] Ready to begin? Type 'CONTINUE' to start...
[AUTO-CAL]   Calibrate the ADS1256 ADC for accurate voltage
[AUTO-CAL]   measurements at your current PGA and data rate
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Store OFC and FSC register values
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ No external loads on ADC inputs
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ System has been running for >2 minutes
[AUTO-CAL] Please wait - this may take up to 30 seconds...
[AUTO-CAL] Type 'CONTINUE' to retry or 'SKIP' to continue anyway...
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸ“‹ STEP B: LOAD CELL CALIBRATION
[AUTO-CAL]   Calibrate the load cells to convert raw ADC values
[AUTO-CAL]   1. Place known masses on the force plate
[AUTO-CAL]   2. System records raw ADC values for each mass
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ At least 3 different known masses
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Must be accurate to Â±0.1% or better
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Total mass should not exceed plate capacity
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Ensure force plate is level and stable
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Do not move or disturb the plate during calibration
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Place masses gently in the center of the plate
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Wait for readings to stabilize before proceeding
[AUTO-CAL]   using masses placed at the CENTER of the plate
[AUTO-CAL]   Calibrate each of the 4 load cells individually
[AUTO-CAL]   2. Place masses in CENTER ({num_masses} mass points)
[AUTO-CAL]   3. Record all 4 load cell responses simultaneously
[AUTO-CAL]   4. Calculate calibration coefficients for all cells
[AUTO-CAL]   2. Span calibration for each cell ({num_masses} mass points)
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Ability to place masses at the CENTER of the plate
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Ability to place masses directly above each corner
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Remove ALL loads from the plate before starting
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Place masses at the EXACT CENTER of the plate
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ All 4 load cells will share the load equally
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ This method is faster and requires fewer masses
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Place masses as centrally as possible above each corner
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Avoid placing masses between load cells
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Wait for stable readings between mass changes
[AUTO-CAL] Ready to start load cell calibration?
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸ”„ STEP B1: TARE (ZERO) ALL LOAD CELLS
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ NO masses or objects on the force plate
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Plate is level and stable
[AUTO-CAL] âœ… All load cells tared successfully!
[AUTO-CAL] âŒ Some load cells failed to tare
[AUTO-CAL] Type 'CONTINUE' to retry or 'SKIP' to continue anyway...
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸ”„ STEP B2: SPAN CALIBRATION SETUP
[AUTO-CAL]   Record raw ADC values for each calibration mass
[AUTO-CAL]   to establish the relationship between mass and ADC readings
[AUTO-CAL]   We will calibrate all load cells with {num_masses} mass points:
[AUTO-CAL]   We will calibrate each load cell with {num_masses} mass points:
[AUTO-CAL]   1. Place mass at the CENTER of the plate
[AUTO-CAL]   2. Wait for reading to stabilize (~10 seconds)
[AUTO-CAL]   3. System records ALL 4 load cell responses
[AUTO-CAL]   4. Remove mass and prepare for next weight
[AUTO-CAL]   1. Place mass directly above the corner
[AUTO-CAL]   2. Wait for reading to stabilize (~10 seconds)
[AUTO-CAL]   3. System will automatically record the reading
[AUTO-CAL]   4. Remove mass and prepare for next point
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Place masses at the EXACT CENTER of the plate
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ All 4 load cells will share the load equally
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ This method is faster and requires fewer masses
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Place masses as close to the load cell as possible
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Avoid placing masses between load cells
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Wait for 'READY FOR NEXT' message before changing masses
[AUTO-CAL] Type 'CONTINUE' to begin with Load Cell 1...
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸ”„ Remove all masses from the plate
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸ”„ Place {mass_kg} kg at the CENTER of the plate
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸ”„ Remove all masses from Load Cell {cell_num} area
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸ”„ Place {mass_kg} kg directly above Load Cell {cell_num}
[AUTO-CAL] Wait for reading to stabilize, then type 'CONTINUE'...
[AUTO-CAL] âœ… All 4 load cells recorded successfully!
[AUTO-CAL] âŒ Failed to record calibration point!
[AUTO-CAL] Type 'CONTINUE' to retry or 'SKIP' to skip this point...
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸ”„ STEP B3: COMPUTING SPAN COEFFICIENTS
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸ“Š Analyzing calibration data for all load cells...
[AUTO-CAL] Computing span coefficients and linearity errors...
[AUTO-CAL] â­ï¸ Step C (Matrix Calibration) is DISABLED
[AUTO-CAL] Skipping to final save and verification...
[AUTO-CAL] â­ï¸ Step C (Matrix Calibration) is DISABLED
[AUTO-CAL] Skipping to final save and verification...
[AUTO-CAL] â„¹ï¸ Note: Without matrix calibration, you will have:
[AUTO-CAL]   âœ“ Individual load cell force measurements
[AUTO-CAL]   âœ— No center of pressure (COP) calculations
[AUTO-CAL]   Create mapping from 4 load cell outputs to:
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Moments about X and Y axes (Mx, My)
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Center of pressure coordinates (COPx, COPy)
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Place 10kg mass at 9 different positions
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Record load cell responses at each position
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Measuring tape for position verification
[AUTO-CAL] âš ï¸ This step is OPTIONAL:
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Type 'CONTINUE' to perform matrix calibration
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Type 'SKIP' to skip and complete calibration
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸ“¦ Place 10kg mass at coordinates: ({x_mm}, {y_mm}) mm
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸŽ¯ CENTER: Place mass at the exact center of the plate
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸŽ¯ FRONT: Place mass {y_mm} mm toward the front
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸŽ¯ BACK: Place mass {y_mm_abs} mm toward the back
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸŽ¯ RIGHT: Place mass {x_mm} mm toward the right
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸŽ¯ LEFT: Place mass {x_mm_abs} mm toward the left
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸŽ¯ CORNER: Place mass at corner position
[AUTO-CAL] Wait for reading to stabilize, then type 'CONTINUE'...
[AUTO-CAL] Type 'CONTINUE' to retry or 'SKIP' to skip this position...
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸ”„ STEP C: COMPUTING MATRIX COEFFICIENTS
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸ”„ Saving calibration data to EEPROM...
[AUTO-CAL] âŒ Failed to save calibration data!
[AUTO-CAL] âš ï¸ Calibrated measurements not available
[AUTO-CAL]   âœ“ Step B: Load cell calibration (4 cells)
[AUTO-CAL] ðŸŽ¯ YOUR FORCE PLATE IS NOW READY FOR:
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Use 'CAL_FORCE_DATA' to see real-time measurements
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Record calibration date and conditions
[AUTO-CAL]   â€¢ Document masses and equipment used
[AUTO-CAL] Thank you for using the automated calibration system!
[AUTO-CAL] âš ï¸ Please wait for the current step to complete
[AUTO-CAL] â“ Unknown command. Use: CONTINUE, SKIP, ABORT, STATUS, or CAL_CONFIG_*
[AUTO-CAL] â­ï¸ Step skipped - moving to next phase
[AUTO-CAL] âœ“ Custom calibration masses set ({num_masses} masses)
[AUTO-CAL] âœ“ Reset to default calibration masses (0, 5, 10, 15, 20 kg)
[AUTO-CAL] âŒ Invalid mass format. Use: CAL_CONFIG_MASSES 5.0,10.0,15.0,20.0

placeholders.mass_note: Additional note for mass (e.g., ' (no load)' for 0kg)
placeholders.x_mm_abs: Absolute value of X coordinate in mm
placeholders.y_mm_abs: Absolute value of Y coordinate in mm
placeholders.mass_placement: CENTER of plate or Individual corners
placeholders.placement: CENTER of plate or INDIVIDUAL load cell corners
placeholders.cop_x: Center of pressure X coordinate in mm
placeholders.cop_y: Center of pressure Y coordinate in mm

conditions.center_placement: Masses are placed at center of plate (vs individual corners)
